metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7056 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A timing attack flaw was found in OpenSSL 1.0.1u and before that could allow a malicious user with local access to recover ECDSA P-256 private keys.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu10
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu10').
